intro: Agrostis idahoensis, commonly known as Idaho grass, is a perennial grass species native to North America. It is characterized by its fine, tufted foliage and is often found in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, cylindrical stems. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet at the tip of each stem, which is a defining feature of the Poaceae family. Agrostis idahoensis is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions, making it a resilient and ecologically important species.
